page.title: 07STONEHENGE POP FESTIVAL
page.content: In June each year thousands of pop fans converge on the site owned by the National Trust near Stonehenge to "celebrate" the Summer Solstice with an illegal festival of pop music. This has caused anxiety among local residents for a variety of reasons: 1 There are no facilities, this causes (a) Serious health risks - no toilets or proper running water. (b) Mountains of foul smelling rubbish, abandoned cars etc. (c) Damage to trees in the Fargo Plantation, crops and fences. 2 Attracts drug pushers and such like. 3 Shoplifting and theft are increased. 4 Congestion on roads by hitch-hikers. There are, of course, those who feel that the festival should be allowed to continue and that facilities should be provided, but generally most residents are against it taking place.
